newsitem.title: ALBANIA: Albania moves to probe spiralling pyramid schemes.
newsitem.headline: Albania moves to probe spiralling pyramid schemes.

text.p: Albanian parliamentarians have called for the setting up of a parliamentary committee to investigate the Balkan country's 'get-rich-quick' pyramid schemes, an Albanian newspaper reported on Thursday.
The parliamentary committee would consist of economic experts to control how the money invested into the pyramid schemes of companies is used, daily Rilindja Demokratike said.
Pyramid schemes started cropping up four years ago as new companies looked for other sources of cash, which the former Stalinist state's overstretched banking system could not supply.
They have lured hundreds of thousands of investors nationwide with pledges of big returns on small investments.
Currently, numerous firms offer interest rates of up to 50 percent a month on short-term loans for Albanians, many of them living hand to mouth.
The prospect of staggering returns has driven Europe's poorest citizens to hand over their hard-won savings, even selling their homes and livestock in order to join the goldrush.
But the schemes have begun distorting currency markets and have set off alarm bells at the international organizations.
The World Bank has expressed concern over the burgeoning pyramid schemes and last week, an International Monetary Fund delegation arrived in Albania to scrutinise the business.
Bankers warn the pyramid system could implode, robbing the man in the street of his life savings and paralysing the economy.
